Letters patent granted by Robert the Second, King of Scots, in favour of the Prior and Friars Preachers of Ayr, talring them, their lands, men, and whole possessione and goods, movable and 'immovable ecclesiastical and secular, under his sure peace and protectior, prohibiting any one from doing thern any injustice under pain of forfaiture, and from seizing their goods or those of their men for the debt, pledge, or forfeit of anyone unless for their own proper debt, pledge, or forfeit, saving the king’s burghs; and straitly charging justiciars, sheriffs, provests, and their bailias, that they compel all those in their respective jurisdictione who owe debts to these friars, to pay the same without delay. Dated at Perth leth February, second year of reign. (1372-3.)
